author: Jeff Geerling
description:
Can we build a private AI cluster in a mini rack with Framework's Desktop motherboard?

Mentioned in this video:

  - Framework Desktop: https://frame.work/desktop
  - Level1Techs review of Framework Desktop: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L-xgMQ-7lW0
  - Beowulf AI Cluster project: https://github.com/geerlingguy/beowulf-ai-cluster
  - Blog post with all test results: https://www.jeffgeerling.com/blog/2025/i-clustered-four-framework-mainboards-test-huge-llms
  - Other test results and benchmarks for the Framework Mainboard: https://github.com/geerlingguy/sbc-reviews/issues/80
  - DeskPi RackMate T1 (Black - US): https://amzn.to/456iuXv
  - DeskPi RackMate T1 (Black - EU): https://www.amazon.de/dp/B0FBFDZD4C?th=1

Framework sent the units used in this review, and DeskPi sent a mini rack and four rack trays to mount the Framework hardware. Neither company paid me, nor had any input into my testing or the production of the video. See my review video policies: https://github.com/geerling
title: I built a private AI mini-cluster with Framework Desktop
